label: MCP Server Developers
rationale: Developers building Model Context Protocol servers are the most direct user base for Thoughtbox. They already understand the protocol, tool registration, and session management patterns. Thoughtbox is itself an MCP server, so integration is natural.

query.query: Model Context Protocol MCP server implementations and tools

criteria.description: Repository implements or extends the Model Context Protocol (MCP)
Has meaningful code (not just a fork or template with no changes)
Updated within the last 6 months

enrichments.description: Extract the repository owner's GitHub username, email if available in profile, and any linked personal website or blog
Describe what the repository does and how it relates to AI reasoning or agent coordination

label: AI Agent Framework Companies
rationale: Companies building agent frameworks (LangChain, CrewAI, AutoGen equivalents) need structured reasoning FOR their agents. Thoughtbox provides exactly what they would integrate -- thought chains, branching, multi-agent collaboration.

query.query: startups building AI agent frameworks and orchestration platforms

criteria.description: Company builds tools or frameworks for creating AI agents
Company has a publicly available product or open source project
Company is a startup or growth-stage, not a large enterprise like Google or Microsoft

enrichments.description: Extract the company's website URL, contact email, and any public contact form
Determine if the company uses AI agents or LLMs in their core product workflow

label: Claude Code Power Users
rationale: People who use AI coding assistants daily and share workflows publicly are natural early adopters. They already live in agent-assisted workflows and would immediately see the value of adding structured reasoning.

query.query: Claude Code or Claude AI coding assistant workflow tips and experiences

criteria.description: Tweet discusses using Claude Code, Claude AI, or similar AI coding assistants for development work
Tweet author has a GitHub profile link or lists a technical role (engineer, developer, CTO) in their Twitter bio
Tweet describes a specific workflow, tip, or use case, not just generic praise

enrichments.description: Extract the tweet author's Twitter handle, display name, and bio description
Determine if the author builds developer tools or primarily uses them as an end user

v2_changes: REVISED: criteria[1] changed from subjective 'appears to be a developer' to web-observable 'has GitHub profile link or lists technical role'. Count reduced 100->50 to cut noise.

label: Multi-Agent System Repositories
rationale: Repositories implementing multi-agent AI coordination are directly adjacent to Thoughtbox's multi-agent hub feature. Their maintainers would have deep opinions on collaboration protocols and structured reasoning.

query.query: multi-agent AI systems with coordination and collaboration between multiple LLM agents

criteria.description: Repository implements multi-agent coordination or collaboration between AI agents
Repository has documentation and is not abandoned (updated in last year)

enrichments.description: Extract the repository owner's GitHub username, email if available, and any linked website
Describe the multi-agent architecture used and how agents coordinate

label: AI Safety & Alignment Researchers
rationale: AI safety researchers do some of the most rigorous reasoning in the AI field -- formal arguments, thought experiments, red-teaming. They need tools that make reasoning chains auditable, reviewable, and shareable.

query.query: AI alignment and safety researchers publishing on responsible AI development

criteria.description: Person has published research or written publicly about AI safety, alignment, or responsible AI
Person is affiliated with a research lab, university, or AI safety organization
Person is active in the AI safety community (not just one tangential mention)

enrichments.description: Find the person's email address, Twitter/X handle, and personal website or blog
Summarize what reasoning-intensive work this person does and their main research focus

label: AI-Native Startups
rationale: Broad funnel for companies whose core product relies on LLMs. They face reasoning quality challenges daily and would benefit from structured reasoning tooling to improve their AI workflows.

query.query: AI-native startups using large language models in their core product

criteria.description: Company's website prominently describes their product as AI-powered, LLM-based, or built on large language models
Company's core product relies on LLMs, not just uses AI as a feature
Company appears to be a startup or growth-stage company, not a publicly-traded Fortune 500 enterprise

enrichments.description: Extract the company's website URL, contact email, and any public contact form
Determine if the company uses AI agents or LLMs in their workflow or product

v2_changes: REVISED: criteria[0] changed from 'founded after 2022' to web-observable 'website describes product as AI-powered'. criteria[2] changed from 'fewer than 200 employees' to 'appears startup/growth-stage, not Fortune 500'. Both changes make criteria verifiable from web data.

label: Developer Tool Companies with AI Integration
rationale: Companies building IDEs, CLI tools, code assistants, and development workflow tools with AI integration are natural partners. They could integrate Thoughtbox or recommend it to their users.

query.query: companies building developer tools with AI-powered features

criteria.description: Company builds tools for software developers (IDE, CLI, testing, deployment)
Company has an AI or LLM integration in their product

enrichments.description: Extract the company's website URL, contact email, and any public contact form
Determine if the company uses AI agents or LLMs in their workflow or product

v2_changes: REVISED: query string changed from 'developer tools companies building IDE plugins code assistants and development workflow tools' to 'companies building developer tools with AI-powered features' for clarity.

label: Chain-of-Thought Reasoning Researchers
rationale: Researchers working on chain-of-thought, tree-of-thought, and structured prompting are building the theoretical foundation that Thoughtbox operationalizes. They would provide the most technically informed feedback.

query.query: chain of thought reasoning and structured prompting techniques for large language models

criteria.description: Paper discusses chain-of-thought, tree-of-thought, or structured reasoning for LLMs
Paper proposes or evaluates a method, not just a survey

enrichments.description: Extract the first author's name, email address, and institutional affiliation
Summarize the paper's approach to structured reasoning and how it relates to externalizing thought chains

label: Open Source Maintainers Using AI Tools
rationale: Open source maintainers who use AI assistants face complex triage, RFC, and architecture decision workflows. Thoughtbox's structured reasoning and ADR-like thought chains map directly to their needs.

query.query: open source project maintainers using AI assistants and copilots for development

criteria.description: Person is publicly known as a maintainer of a widely-used open source project in AI, developer tools, or related infrastructure
Person has discussed using AI coding tools publicly (blog, tweets, talks)

enrichments.description: Find the person's email address, Twitter/X handle, and personal website or blog
Summarize what reasoning-intensive work this person does in open source maintenance

v2_changes: REVISED: criteria[0] changed from quantitative '100+ GitHub stars' to qualitative 'publicly known as maintainer of widely-used open source project'. Exa cannot verify star counts from web data.

label: OSINT & Threat Intelligence Companies
rationale: OSINT and threat intelligence firms do structured hypothesis testing, evidence collection, and source triangulation -- exactly what Thoughtbox mental models (OODA loop) support. The OODA loop is literally built into Thoughtbox.

query.query: open source intelligence OSINT and threat intelligence analysis companies

criteria.description: Company provides OSINT, threat intelligence, or competitive intelligence services or tools
Company uses structured analysis methodologies or analytical frameworks
Company is actively operating (has a website and recent activity)

enrichments.description: Extract the company's website URL, contact email, and any public contact form
Determine if the company uses AI agents or LLMs in their analysis workflow

label: Technical Educators & AI Content Creators
rationale: Technical educators creating content about AI, LLMs, and prompt engineering could both use Thoughtbox for their own reasoning and amplify it to their audiences. They serve as multipliers for awareness.

query.query: technical educators and content creators teaching AI development and prompt engineering

criteria.description: Person creates educational content about AI, LLMs, or prompt engineering
Person has an active blog, YouTube channel, newsletter, or online course

enrichments.description: Find the person's email address, Twitter/X handle, and personal website or blog
Summarize what topics they teach and what platforms they use to reach their audience

v2_changes: PROMOTED: priority changed from low to medium. Reviewer noted these are high-value multipliers who both use Thoughtbox and amplify it to audiences.

label: AI Consultants & ML Freelancers
rationale: AI consultants and ML freelancers do reasoning-heavy client work -- evaluating architectures, making technology recommendations, designing AI systems. They need tools for structured analysis and would be direct Thoughtbox users. Replaces original Q12 (VC firms) which were unlikely to use Thoughtbox themselves.

query.query: AI consultants, ML engineering freelancers, and technical AI strategy advisors

criteria.description: Profile describes person as AI/ML consultant, freelance ML engineer, or technical strategy advisor
Person offers consulting services related to AI implementation, LLM integration, or ML systems
Person has public evidence of client work or thought leadership (blog, talks, case studies)

enrichments.description: Extract the person's name, LinkedIn URL, personal website, and email if available
Describe their consulting focus areas and whether they work with AI agent systems or reasoning tools

v2_changes: REPLACED: Was 'AI-Focused VC & Analyst Firms' (company entity). Now 'AI Consultants & ML Freelancers' (linkedin_profile entity). VC firms unlikely to use Thoughtbox; consultants are direct users. Also adds linkedin_profile coverage.

label: AI/ML Engineers & Prompt Engineers
rationale: LinkedIn is the most direct path to finding professionals by role. AI/ML engineers and prompt engineers working on LLM applications are the core individual user base for Thoughtbox -- they build and debug AI systems daily and need structured reasoning tooling.

query.query: AI engineers, ML engineers, and prompt engineers building LLM applications

criteria.description: Profile lists role as AI/ML engineer, prompt engineer, AI product manager, or similar AI-focused technical role
Profile shows current employment at a technology or AI company
Profile indicates hands-on work with LLMs, AI agents, or machine learning systems

enrichments.description: Extract the person's name, current company, role title, and LinkedIn URL
Determine if the person builds AI tools and infrastructure or primarily uses them as an end user

v2_changes: NEW: Fills the biggest gap identified by reviewer -- no linkedin_profile queries in Round 1. LinkedIn is the most direct path to finding professionals by role.

label: Enterprise AI/ML Platform Teams
rationale: Large companies with dedicated AI/ML platform teams have budget, structured decision-making needs, and complex reasoning workflows. They build internal tooling and evaluate external tools for their teams -- a natural enterprise adoption path for Thoughtbox.

query.query: large technology companies with dedicated AI and machine learning platform teams

criteria.description: Company has a dedicated AI/ML platform or infrastructure team (visible from job postings, engineering blogs, or team pages)
Company is an established enterprise (not an early-stage startup)
Company's engineering blog or public communications discuss AI/ML tooling, agent systems, or LLM integration

enrichments.description: Extract the company's website URL, engineering blog URL, and any public contact for the AI/ML team
Describe what AI/ML platform work the company does publicly and whether they build internal tools

v2_changes: NEW: Fills enterprise coverage gap. Reviewer noted large companies with internal AI/ML platforms were missing from Round 1.
